articles.title: Sticklebacks may pass information learned from other fish to offspring
articles.description: Stickleback fish can learn about predators by observing their peers. They may then be able to pass that information onto their offspring – without ever interacting with them
articles.content:
By James Dinneen
Male three-spined sticklebacks may pass on information about predators to their offspring
Brian Stauffer
In all organisms, life experience and environment such as diet and exposur… [+419 chars]

articles.title: AI art tool DALL-E 2 adds 'black' or 'female' to some image prompts
articles.description: Researchers experimenting with OpenAI's text-to-image tool, DALL-E 2, noticed that it seems to covertly be adding words such as "black" and "female" to image prompts, seemingly in an effort to diversify its output
articles.content:
By Matthew Sparkes
DALL-E 2 is a text-to-image generating artificial intelligence
STEFANI REYNOLDS/AFP via Getty Images
Artificial intelligence firm OpenAI seems to be covertly modifying requests … [+417 chars]

articles.title: Cambridge lab for clever birds saved from closure by public donations
articles.description: The "corvid palace", a renowned UK centre for research on intelligence in crows and their kin that was due to be shut down this month, has been saved by a campaign kick-started by a New Scientist article
articles.content:
By Alison George
Two rooks at the Comparative Cognition Lab
Francesca M. Cornero/University of Cambridge

articles.title: Gene-edited dogs created from cloned skin cells for the first time
articles.description: New gene-editing approach could be used to eliminate disease-causing mutations from pedigree dog breeds or even from clones of individual dogs
articles.content:
By Michael Le Page
Gene-edited beagle puppies
Okjae Koo/ToolGen
Two beagle dogs have been born in South Korea from cloned skin cells altered by CRISPR gene editing. CRISPR-edited dogs have previou… [+436 chars]

articles.title: Firing a laser into the sky can redirect lightning’s path
articles.description: A laser fired from a tower on a mountain seems to have redirected lightning in the sky and could be used to make storm clouds discharge lightning safely
articles.content:
By Alex Wilkins
A thunderstorm over Las Vegas, Nevada
Ethan Miller/Getty Images
A laser that redirects lightning could be used to protect critical buildings during storms.
When an electric charge… [+427 chars]

articles.title: How can the UK keep homes cool without air conditioning?
articles.description: To adapt to climate change, the UK needs to install “passive cooling” mechanisms in homes, such as window shades and improved ventilation systems
articles.content:

Shutters, a common sight in France, are more effective for cooling than interior shading

articles.title: Top 10 search results from Google and Bing differ by up to 75 per cent
articles.description: An analysis of search results in the US and Germany found that the top 10 results from Google and other search engines differ widely

articles.title: Astronomers are mapping millions of hidden galaxies
articles.description: Millions of distant galaxies are obscured by the Magellanic Clouds, which orbit the Milky Way. However, using several different telescopes, astronomers can see beyond them to build a 3D map of the hidden galaxies
articles.content:
By Karmela Padavic-Callaghan
The Small Magellanic Cloud
ESA/Hubble and Digitized Sky Survey
Astronomers are building a three-dimensional map of millions of distant galaxies that are normally block… [+411 chars]

articles.title: We don't actually know what 'growing pains' are
articles.description: They are reportedly the most common cause of muscle or bone pain in adolescents. But it's unclear what "growing pains" are – or if they are even related to growth
articles.content:
By Grace Wade
“Growing pains” are reportedly the leading cause of bone or muscle pain in adolescents
EyeEm/Alamy
The term growing pains is often used to refer to sore or aching limbs in children. … [+2753 chars]

articles.title: Fast way of making pufferfish’s neurotoxin may lead to new pain drugs
articles.description: Tetrodotoxin, the poison found in pufferfish, is an essential tool for neuroscience research, and a better technique to synthesise it could boost research into drugs that relieve pain
articles.content:

Some pufferfish accumulate stores of the potent nerve poison tetrodotoxin inside them
